intro: Sloanea erismoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sloanea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, followed by woody, spiny capsules containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
